title: Authors and Citation
text: Thompson H (2025). measure: Automatic Unit Handling Numeric Vectors. R package version 0.1.0, https://hrryt.github.io/measure/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {measure: Automatic Unit Handling for Numeric Vectors},   author = {Harry Thompson},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://hrryt.github.io/measure/}, }

what: Automatic Unit Handling for Numeric Vectors
title: Automatic Unit Handling for Numeric Vectors
text: goal measure integrate automatic unit handling data analysis workflows.

title: Automatic Unit Handling for Numeric Vectors
text: can install measure following command: can install development version measure like :

title: Automatic Unit Handling for Numeric Vectors
text: Use measure() make new measure objects convert units. Units handled carrying arithmetic operations. Units automatically annotated onto ggplot2 plots ‘enmeasured’ scales. Every ggplot2 scale *_measure equivalent.  measure works seamlessly difftime hms objects, lubridate periods, intervals durations. Unlike time objects, measure units preserved summary functions.
code: library(tidyverse) library(measure) bodyindex <- starwars |>   mutate(     mass = measure(mass, "kg"), # add units to a measurement     height = measure(height, "c|m"), # vertical bar indicates SI prefix     bmi0 = mass / height^2, # arithmetic operators preserve units     bmi = measure(bmi0, "kg m^-2") # convert units   ) |>   select(name:mass, bmi0:bmi)  bodyindex |> arrange(desc(mass)) #> # A tibble: 87 × 5 #>    name                     height      mass             bmi0           bmi #>    <chr>                 <measure> <measure>        <measure>     <measure> #>  1 Jabba Desilijic Tiure    175 cm   1358 kg 0.0443  kg cm^-2 443.  kg m^-2 #>  2 Grievous                 216 cm    159 kg 0.00341 kg cm^-2  34.1 kg m^-2 #>  3 IG-88                    200 cm    140 kg 0.0035  kg cm^-2  35   kg m^-2 #>  4 Darth Vader              202 cm    136 kg 0.00333 kg cm^-2  33.3 kg m^-2 #>  5 Tarfful                  234 cm    136 kg 0.00248 kg cm^-2  24.8 kg m^-2 #>  6 Owen Lars                178 cm    120 kg 0.00379 kg cm^-2  37.9 kg m^-2 #>  7 Bossk                    190 cm    113 kg 0.00313 kg cm^-2  31.3 kg m^-2 #>  8 Chewbacca                228 cm    112 kg 0.00215 kg cm^-2  21.5 kg m^-2 #>  9 Jek Tono Porkins         180 cm    110 kg 0.00340 kg cm^-2  34.0 kg m^-2 #> 10 Dexter Jettster          198 cm    102 kg 0.00260 kg cm^-2  26.0 kg m^-2 #> # ℹ 77 more rows breaks <- scales::breaks_extended(7)  bodyindex |>   filter(mass < measure(200, "kg")) |>   ggplot(aes(mass, height, color = bmi)) +   geom_point(size = 5) +   # two methods of achieving the same thing:   scale_x_log10(breaks = breaks) |> enmeasure_scale() +   scale_y_log10_measure(breaks = breaks) +   # units are appended onto the label of an 'enmeasured' scale:   scale_color_viridis_c_measure(trans = "log10") +   labs(color = "BMI", title = "Body Mass Index of Star Wars Characters") (plays <- lakers |>   tibble() |>   mutate(     date = ymd(date),     time = ms(time),     team,     points = measure(points, "point"),     .keep = "used"   )) #> # A tibble: 34,624 × 4 #>    date       time     team     points #>    <date>     <Period> <chr> <measure> #>  1 2008-10-28 12M 0S   OFF     0 point #>  2 2008-10-28 11M 39S  LAL     0 point #>  3 2008-10-28 11M 37S  LAL     0 point #>  4 2008-10-28 11M 25S  LAL     0 point #>  5 2008-10-28 11M 23S  LAL     0 point #>  6 2008-10-28 11M 22S  LAL     2 point #>  7 2008-10-28 11M 22S  POR     0 point #>  8 2008-10-28 11M 22S  LAL     1 point #>  9 2008-10-28 11M 0S   LAL     0 point #> 10 2008-10-28 10M 53S  POR     2 point #> # ℹ 34,614 more rows plays |>   mutate(time = measure(time, "min")) |>   group_by(date, team) |>   summarise(     time = max(time),     points = sum(points),     rate = points / time,     .groups = "keep"   ) |>   group_by(team) |>   summarise(     time = first(time),     points = mean(points),     rate = median(rate)   ) #> # A tibble: 31 × 4 #>    team       time      points              rate #>    <chr> <measure>   <measure>         <measure> #>  1 ATL    11.7 min  84.5 point 7.21 point min^-1 #>  2 BOS    11.8 min  96   point 8.13 point min^-1 #>  3 CHA    11.8 min  94   point 7.93 point min^-1 #>  4 CHI    11.7 min 109   point 9.26 point min^-1 #>  5 CLE    11.8 min  89.5 point 7.63 point min^-1 #>  6 DAL    11.9 min 102   point 8.45 point min^-1 #>  7 DEN    11.8 min  92.5 point 7.92 point min^-1 #>  8 DET    11.8 min  91.5 point 7.76 point min^-1 #>  9 GSW    11.8 min 111   point 9.01 point min^-1 #> 10 HOU    11.8 min  89.8 point 7.55 point min^-1 #> # ℹ 21 more rows

title: Convert Units — convert_units
text: Convert units measure object newly specified units.

title: Convert Units — convert_units
text: x measure object units character value

title: Convert Units — convert_units
text: measure object new units

title: Convert Units — convert_units
code: x <- measure(1:5, "m s^-1") convert_units(x, "k|m hour^-1") #> <measure[5]> #> [1]  3.6 km hour^-1  7.2 km hour^-1 10.8 km hour^-1 14.4 km hour^-1 #> [5] 18.0 km hour^-1

what: Add Units to A Scale — enmeasure_scale
title: Add Units to A Scale — enmeasure_scale
text: Create ggplot2::ggproto object inherits super, designed ggplot2 scale measure objects adds units aesthetic label.

title: Add Units to A Scale — enmeasure_scale
Add Units to A Scale — enmeasure_scale
text: super ggplot2::Scale object returned scale_*() function like ggplot2::scale_x_continuous()

title: Add Units to A Scale — enmeasure_scale
text: ggplot2::Scale object

title: Add Units to A Scale — enmeasure_scale
text: make_title() redefined return formula derived super$make_title() units. See plot_math(). transform() redefined set units units(x) pass plain double super$transform().

title: Add Units to A Scale — enmeasure_scale
code: library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(measure(displ, "L"))) + geom_histogram() s <- scale_x_continuous("Engine displacement") p + enmeasure_scale(s) #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.

title: For S4 methods that require a documentation entry but only clutter the index. — hidden_aliases
text: S4 methods require documentation entry clutter index.

what: Check for and Coerce to Measure — is_measure
title: Check for and Coerce to Measure — is_measure
text: Check object inherits measure class, coerce measure.

title: Check for and Coerce to Measure — is_measure
Check for and Coerce to Measure — is_measure
text: x R object

title: Check for and Coerce to Measure — is_measure
text: is_measure(), logical value. as_measure(), result measure()

title: Check for and Coerce to Measure — is_measure
text: .measure() .measure() aliases is_measure() as_measure() respectively.

title: Check for and Coerce to Measure — is_measure
code: (x <- measure(1:5, "m")) #> <measure[5]> #> [1] 1 m 2 m 3 m 4 m 5 m is_measure(x) #> [1] TRUE (y <- as_measure(1:5)) #> <measure[5]> #> [1] 1 2 3 4 5 is_measure(y) #> [1] TRUE

what: measure: Automatic Unit Handling for Numeric Vectors — measure-package
title: measure: Automatic Unit Handling for Numeric Vectors — measure-package
text: Adds new class 'measure' methods base functions, arithmetic comparative operators summary functions, defined units 'measure' objects automatically updated. Allows conversion units, compatible various time interval objects, e.g. 'lubridate' periods, custom 'ggplot2' scales.

title: measure: Automatic Unit Handling for Numeric Vectors — measure-package
text: Maintainer: Harry Thompson harry@mayesfield.uk [copyright holder]

title: Measures — measure
text: class utility methods numeric values units

title: Measures — measure
code: measure(x = double(), units = attr(x, "units"))  # S4 method for class 'measure' units(x)  # S4 method for class 'measure' units(x) <- value

title: Measures — measure
text: x numeric vector, measure, difftime, lubridate::duration, lubridate::interval, lubridate::period object units, value character value. See Details

title: Measures — measure
text: object class measure

title: Measures — measure
text: x lubridate Duration, Interval Period object, converted difftime running default method. x already measure convert_units() called.

title: Measures — measure
text: Units specified following format: "multiplier prefix1|unit1^exponent1 prefix2|unit2^exponent2 ...". multiplier, prefixes exponents optional. example, measure(x, "10 c|m^2 s^-1") add units ten centimeters per second, measure(x, "m") simply meters. Prefixes can SI prefixes: Q, R, Y, Z, E, P, T, G, M, k, h, da, d, c, m, µ, (micro), n, p, f, , z, y, r, q. Units restriction, although difftime units converted s, min, hour, day week.

title: Measures — measure
code: (speed <- measure(1:5, "m s^-1")) #> <measure[5]> #> [1] 1 m s^-1 2 m s^-1 3 m s^-1 4 m s^-1 5 m s^-1 (time <- measure(50, "min")) #> <measure[1]> #> [1] 50 min as.difftime(time) #> Time difference of 50 mins (distance <- speed * time) #> <measure[5]> #> [1]  50 m s^-1 min 100 m s^-1 min 150 m s^-1 min 200 m s^-1 min 250 m s^-1 min units(distance) #> m s^-1 min  (distance <- measure(distance, "k|m")) #> <measure[5]> #> [1]  3 km  6 km  9 km 12 km 15 km  distance[2:3] <- measure(200, "m") distance^2 #> <measure[5]> #> [1]   9.00 km^2   0.04 km^2   0.04 km^2 144.00 km^2 225.00 km^2 mean(distance) #> <measure[1]> #> [1] 6.08 km  units(distance) <- "kilometers" range(distance) #> <measure[2]> #> [1]  0.2 kilometers 15.0 kilometers as.numeric(distance) #> [1]  3.0  0.2  0.2 12.0 15.0  units(distance) <- NULL distance #> <measure[5]> #> [1]  3.0  0.2  0.2 12.0 15.0 log(distance) #> <measure[5]> #> [1]  1.098612 -1.609438 -1.609438  2.484907  2.708050

title: Mathematical Annotation of Measures — plot_math
text: Create formula plotmath plot annotation measure object.

title: Mathematical Annotation of Measures — plot_math
text: x measure object units() sub main label, passed format()

title: Mathematical Annotation of Measures — plot_math
text: formula obeying plotmath syntax rules

title: Mathematical Annotation of Measures — plot_math
code: x <- measure(1:5, "k|m s^-1") plot_math(x) #> x ~ `/` ~ km ~ s^-1 #> <environment: 0x561144d5b378> plot(x)  plot(x, ylab = plot_math(x, "Speed"))

title: Scales for Measure Data — scale_measure
text: ggplot2 scales add units measure objects aesthetic labels

title: Scales for Measure Data — scale_measure
code: scale_linewidth_ordinal_measure(...)  scale_fill_fermenter_measure(...)  scale_linetype_manual_measure(...)  scale_color_viridis_b_measure(...)  scale_color_viridis_c_measure(...)  scale_color_viridis_d_measure(...)  scale_fill_ordinal_measure(...)  scale_alpha_identity_measure(...)  scale_size_datetime_measure(...)  scale_linetype_discrete_measure(...)
